name: College Football Data API MCP Server

parameters.content:
## üõ†Ô∏è College Football Data MCP Server ‚úÖ 51 operations

### About
This is an API for accessing all sorts of college football data.  Please note that API keys should be supplied with "Bearer " prepended (e.g. "Bearer your_key"). API keys can be acquired from the CollegeFootballData.com website.

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the College Football Data API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://api.collegefootballdata.com
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent

### üìã Available Operations (51 endpoints)

**Games (9 operations)**
season, advanced, games, game, player, team, live

**Coaches (1 operations)**
coaching

**Conferences (1 operations)**
conferences

**Draft (3 operations)**
list

**Drives (1 operations)**
drive

**Betting (1 operations)**
betting

**Plays (5 operations)**
live, types, play

**Metrics (7 operations)**
win, pregame, team, player, predicted

**Players (5 operations)**
transfer, team, search, player

**Rankings (1 operations)**
historical

**Ratings (4 operations)**
historical

**Recruiting (3 operations)**
recruit, player, team

**Teams (5 operations)**
team, fbs

**Stats (4 operations)**
team, advanced

**Venues (1 operations)**
arena

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Configure Authentication**: Set up apiKey credentials
   - Type: API Key in header
   - Key name: Authorization

3. **Activate Workflow**: Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**: Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration

### üí° Usage Notes

‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 51 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure
### üõ†Ô∏è Customization

‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### üí¨ Need Help?
Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) or ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for MCP integration guidance or customizations.

parameters.toolDescription:
Season calendar

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ year (required) - Year filter

Advanced box scores

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ gameId (required) - Game id parameters

parameters.name: id
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('id', 'id filter for querying a single game', 'number') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Games and results

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ year (required) - Year/season filter for games
  ‚Ä¢ week (optional) - Week filter
  ‚Ä¢ seasonType (optional) - Season type filter (regular or postseason)
  ‚Ä¢ team (optional) - Team
  ‚Ä¢ home (optional) - Home team filter
  ‚Ä¢ away (optional) - Away team filter
  ‚Ä¢ conference (optional) - Conference abbreviation filter
  ‚Ä¢ division (optional) - Division classification filter (fbs/fcs/ii/iii)
  ‚Ä¢ id (optional) - id filter for querying a single game

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('mediaType', 'Media type filter (tv, radio, web, ppv, or mobile)', 'string') }}
